Reviews.Title: “Cheap And Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Craigie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night on arrival in Rome and then subsequently a further 4 nights after that following a trip away from Rome. I read some reviews so was expecting basic but cheap and cheerful and functional. I was so seriously unimpressed after the first night there that I asked to cancel my subsequent 4 night stay. I was told that I would be charged a nights accommodation to cancel the next booking which yet again gave me the serious hump so I stayed there on my return to Rome. The main things that initially unimpressed me were a) There were 3 busloads of poorly controlled noisy teenage kids staying there on my first night so there was not much sleep to be had!!! I guess they must have been on an archaeological field trip to Ostia Antica!!! b) The restaurant was more like a canteen than a restaurant – very unimpressed with the quality and presentation food!!! Complete rip off in fact. Very friendly staff however even if there was a bit of a language problem!! c) Hotel is pretty much in the middle of nowhere so if you wanted to go elsewhere to eat, you need to get a bus (walking anywhere is tricky are there are no sidewalks / pavements!!! d) The advertised swimming pool was an outdoor pool – and it was closed. The sauna / steam rooms incur a charge of 15 euros per person to use which is ridiculous so we never got to use any of the facilities!!! e) The Air conditioning control in the rooms was not working. It did not matter what temperature you set the thing to, the room stayed at medium oven heat temperature and was roasting! I ended up staying there for the subsequent 4 night stay and eventually changed my mind back from appalling to the place being cheap and cheerful as I had originally expected. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Anyway, there are pros and cons for the hotel.... a) The initial drive from Fiumicino airport, leaving around 7pm on a Wednesday evening took roughly 1 hour to get to the hotel for the 8 Km journey. Traffic in the area is impossible at certain times of the day – and we had SatNav so we didn’t get lost (this is not the hotels fault of course). b) Hotel seems to cater for busloads of people – which if they are kids is a real pain. c) Restaurant for evening meals is very poor for the price they charge!!!! d) Breakfast was OK but you should go early or you will end up with dried out rubbish!! When the kids were there, there was nothing much left. e) 1st room I had was quite cramped and quite basic but functional. 2nd one was larger – ask for a room with a balcony if you can which will give you some outside space as well. f) TV was tiny and ancient and difficult to see it was so small. Only a small number of channels and these were only Italian language!!! Quite poor for a place near an international airport g) Safes in room worked but are way too small for a laptop!!! h) Beds in both rooms squeaked like a stuck pig every time you move. i) Location is not great at all. For the first thing, there are no footpaths to walk along and in typical fashion, walking along the main road is not exactly the safest thing in the world! So you are stuck without a car! Yeah, local bus (every 15 minutes) for 3 stops to train station then train 1, 2 and 3 to the city centre of Rome. There is absolutely nothing in terms of services (shops, bars, restos, etc) within walking distance apart from the Ostia Antica ancient site. We were told best would be to take a bus for 4Kms to the beach where there are some restos on the front! Best to stay by the beach then!! j) Transfer from the airport by arrangement – the minibus will collect you from bus stop number 34 about 5 mins walk from the arrivals at terminal 3 – not very well signposted – as is the case for most things in Italy! They charge 15 euros per room for this service. Pre-booked transport only however! k) You get a lot of traffic noise from the main road nearby to the hotel. Goes on all day and night. There must be a hospital nearby as there was an almost constant scream of ambulances going past at all times of the day and night!! Restaurant Convivium was a joke. Very poor quality poorly thought out evening meal!!! They has a full menu available but were not keen to sell you anything other than the set daily menu for €18 – pasta, steak (which turned out to be pork, water and glass of vinegary wine). If you chose from the full menu, you would pay a fortune for very substandard . The food was canteen standard, the wine was dreadful, etc. The place is geared to churning out mass dinner set menus on the cheap for the bus groups. The prices for off the menu meals were laughable too e.g. Spaghetti Pomodoro (i.e. plate of spaghetti with a tin of chopped tomatoes poured in €11!!!). Drinks prices ridiculous as well!!! I asked to charge food to the room but was told this was not possible and had to pay cash at the table!!! Hotel bar is laughable. It is run by the restaurant – you ring a bell and wait 10 minutes for someone to come to serve you – after a 10 minute wait! Prices ridiculous for what it is!!! Internet: Only by cable in the room. They squeeze another €3 out of you for 1 hour of slow access (€5 for 3 hours and €10 for 12 hours). There is no wireless but they give you an Ethernet cable to connect in the room – not much use for those with internet phones!!! Access speed very slow. To log out from your 1 hour session and stop the time expiring, you have to enter the address http://1.1.1.1/info and then press logout otherwise your credit will expire! Another disorganised and awkward joke the hotel has to offer you! To get to central Rome is not so difficult and quite cheap. Buy a ticket for 1 euro from reception, walk outside to the bus stop, take the bus (no timetable available but runs every 15 minutes – allegedly) for 6 or 7 minutes to the stop just after the ruins entrance, walk along and over the footbridge where you find the Ostia Antica train station. Get on at the platform you come to first and every 15-20 mins there is a train to Pyramide (aka Porto S Paulo) which takes about 25 mins and you are then into the metro system. Watch out for the groups of pickpockets / muggers there though – if you look like a tourist you will be a target!!! Best idea is not to take a wallet with you – if you don’t have one, it cannot be stolen!!! Given the resto at the hotel is a overpriced poor quality joke you might want to look for other options. Nothing much else in area unless you take the bus to Ostia Antica – the best of the limited choices in central Ostia Antica is a small resto called Piazza Ravenna in a nice side street – run by an older couple – good honest reasonably priced food. There is a local bar / pizzeria in the back streets about 10 mins walk from the hotel – shuts at 9h30pm – very much a cheap and cheerful place as well. Not open every day! There is a mid size supermarket called DOC about 10 mins walk away from the hotel – slightly difficult route behind barriers on main road but easier heading away from road an cutting through the local football club. Small bar and pharmacy in small parade of shops next to it. Pizza place as well which I never saw open. Summary: Cheap and cheerful place to stay. Staff very helpful and friendly. I initially thought no way but on reflection, I would probably stay again although there must be hotels in more convenient locations that this one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and utilitarian”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_XLers
Reviews.Content: Ostia Antica is a good choice if one is not looking for luxury and finesse. The rooms here are very basic, but clean. Small-ish hotel, not set in a very picturesque place. There is a small swimming pool and also a wellness spa at this hotel. This is one of those hotels that provides great value for money if you are looking for a decent roof over your head during your visit to Rome. The breakfast spread is not very grand, but is more than sufficient to keep one going!

Reviews.Title: “Just an okay place”
Reviews.Author: Sheila3003
Reviews.Content: I have to say, althought this hotel is close to Airport (FCO) about 15 min. I was not impressed with this hotel. The staff was nice. The room were really basic, clean, but very basic. The basement was the best part of the hotel, really nice spa, great atmosphere. But it will cost you 20 Euros for the use of the Wet Spa. No resturant on premise, but an okay Italian resturant next door. However you can not get Pizza all times of the day. The town of Ostia Antica is quiant. There is an Archelogical Ruin in town. So basicly, if you need a hotel for the night before you fly out, this is an okay hotel, just don't expect much. Be aware that the hotel shuttle runs at certain hours and if you have a flight during the time they don't run, you have to cab it. They don't accomodate beyond the hour they run. There was 7 of us and we had a 6am flight, needed to leave at 4am, we had to get a cab, it was 60 euros for the 7 of us for a 15 min ride. We gave a 10 euro tip because of all of our luggage, post cruise. Need I say more.....

Reviews.Title: “close to the famous ruins of Ostia”
Reviews.Author: EdwinGro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because it was so close to the airport, and close to the extraordinary ruins of Ostia Antica -- hundreds of buildings from the ancient port of Rome. You can get to the archaeological park by free public bus that stops outside the hotel or walk several kms. The hotel is a good value. The room was fine and the staff very friendly. It's a bit of a walk into town to find a restaurant or bar. The hotel itself has only a modest bar and no food in the evening, although the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Ok when you arrive late night and don't want to go straight to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: WORLDSCITIZEN68
Reviews.Content: We choosed this hotel because we arrived late night from Amsterdam and there wasn't train to Rome, so we decided to sleep near the airport to take the train to Rome next day, The hotel is simple but it was cleaned, nice bed and offered a breakfast included in the rate. This was enough for what we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport”
Reviews.Author: HornyViking
Reviews.Content: Ok so you're on a budget. This place is 10 mins from the airport. 15 euro each way in their bus. You need to book it. 3 euro per hour wireless in the lobby. 10 euro for pizza and large beer in Nonnas restaurant next door. Clean basic secure rooms and friendly staff. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “An out of town base”
Reviews.Author: Arklessantaponsa
Reviews.Content: We booked 7 nights in the Ostia Antica Park Hotel as we were visiting family in nearby Acilia. The location is a couple of kms out of Ostia Antica on a busy road. If you are looking for places to walk to eat and drink this may not be the hotel for you, however as a lower cost alternative to Rome it was great. The room was perfectly ok. A comfy bed, nice terrace, TV, minibar and an extremely powerful shower. All spotlessly clean. Breakfast was a buffet affair with a variety of pastries, fruit, ham, cheese etc. There is a restaurant right next door which does great pizza and you can buy it as a takeaway to eat in your room if you wish (2 good size pizzas cost us €14). The communal bar and lounge areas were clean and comfy and the staff were very helpful. It takes 30-40 mins on public transport to get into Rome. Take the 04 bus from outside the hotel to Acilia Station, and from there pick up the train to Basilica Sao Paulo (also known as Pyramid). From here you can access the whole metro system and if you buy a whole day ticket you get unlimited bus and train travel for 4€. The hotel offers a shuttle bus to the airport for 15€ per room, but this stops running at 11am so for afternoon flights a taxi is needed (approx 35€). We paid €351 for 7 nights through a booking site, and to be honest were delighted with the value for money and will certainly use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel from the 80's....or maybe the 70's.....”
Reviews.Author: KarmaTravels007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Italy for a total of 3 amazing weeks. We had the use of a rental car during that time which enabled us to visit many sites, cities and towns. We also had the opportunity to stay at 8 different B&B's and or hotels. This was by far the worse experience we had during this trip and close to the worst accommodations we've ever had during our many years of travel. The nice clean lobby and the outside swimming pool area are the only positive things that this hotel has going for it. The first room that was given to us had a broken door jamb (did someone just break in recently???), and the door couldn't even close properly....the key card didn't work and would not turn on anything that it was suppose to (lights, tv etc). We then asked for another room but not before the front desk asked us if we knew how to use the electronic key card properly. Room number 2 was better but looked like it was from the 70's....unlike any style that I've seen before. This one at least had a deck(which made the room look brighter) and since it was only for a one night stay....well...we conceded that it was ok after flipping back the bed spread and seeing that the bed sheets looked white and clean. Pros: Close to the Ostia Antica ruins(about 1.5 km by car) Cons: Out dated rooms. Bathroom sink was clogged badly so we could only turn on the tap and have the water trickle out or the sink would start to fill up, Shower faucet fell out in my husband's hand, Shower nozzle was full of grunge and needed to be cleaned, top of the bathroom door had a layer of dust on it. Towels provided felt like cheap dish towels, List of swimming pool rules was a page long, Double bed was actually 2 twin beds pushed together...which is ok except that my side of the bed had steel coils digging into my back all night while my husband's side was more padded(obviously his side contained a newer mattress while mind didn't), Also bed was too short for North American standards, the result of pushing twin mattresses together. Stay here only if you are desperate. This is a property that needs renovations badly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: califnonna
Reviews.Content: Driving to the hotel from the ring road was not a pleasant experience, it is located in a depressed slum area filled with graffiti. The location of the hotel is not conducive to wanting to be on the streets.On arriving there was no record of our reservation, the advertised arrival drink and spa experience were not to be had. The safe in our room did not work,we were moved to another room where that safe only worked with a generic code for the hotel. The bar in lobby would not allow drinks to be charged to room, no ice anyway, attached restaurant is separate owner and requires separate payments-not convenient if paying by credit card 9xtra fees) or low on cash. We had gone to area to see the ruins of the port and medieval town and were told at the hotel that they were open the next day( Monday)but as we were leaving to visit we learned all are closed on Monday. Hotel did not offer use of shuttle to go to ruins. Defeated purpose of special trip to area. Breakfast ok, dinner ok, hotel staff very nice, rooms clean, beds comfortable but location and surroundings not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Close and convenient to the airport and old ruins”
Reviews.Author: Skye-mother
Reviews.Content: The hotel facility and rooms aren't much to look at. Nice pool but you have to use the official towels that you rent for 6 Euros. Shuttle service is available which is nice. They will take you to the ruins for free but charge to take you to the airport. They have info about the bus service and can sell you a ticket at the reception desk. The receptionist at the front desk was very nice and let us put our suitcases in one of our rooms even though it was way before check-in time so we could go sightseeing. All of our rooms were ready when we got back. Not great rooms, a little dated. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel. We wanted dinner before it opened (7pm) because we were traveling early the next day. The chef was there and he offered to make us dinner early. The food was very good and we were pleased with the quality and the service. Thank you Chef!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: RachelD33
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located close to Lido which is a beach resort, to the Fuimicino airport and the city of Rome. The hotel staff were helpful and attentive, the rooms and hotel were very clean and beautifully tiled throughout. The pool was refreshing and the poolside was a great place to sit and relax, read or take a nap under the cabanas. The restaurant was of gourmet standing and the breakfast buffet options each morning met the needs very well of all members of our family. The Spa provided the best pedicure I have ever had. The hotel was very well priced for what we received during our stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good ration Quality/Price”
Reviews.Author: stefano32
Reviews.Content: The hotel is normal business hotel, not so new but clean and well organized. The location is very confortable for Fiumicino Airport, the team is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonable And Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RickMIusa
Reviews.Content: This is not a multi-star hotel. It is a small extremely well placed hotel that international travelers are getting to know. It's located a long walk from the famous Ostia Antica ancient ruins of the port of Rome. The hotel bus will drop you at the entrance, which is a block and a bridge from the Metro stop into Rome itself. The hotel shuttle runs on scheduled hrs (check them because it;s about a third of the cost of a taxi) and if your flight arrives so you can phone them, pick up is usually 15-30 minutes.....not too bad a wait for the savings. The shuttle will also take you over to the beaches, shopping. or the ruins at no charge. Some people complain that the shuttle is not a 24 hr a day operation, but you get what you get. Food here is not high cuisine but it still is something to eat - have low expectations to avoid disappointment. Some staff have bad attitudes and you just kind of have to work around them......my wife and I have stayed here several times.....its cheap and very well placed. This time around they did a fax for nothing, provided ice when we asked for it, ran the shuttle when we needed it.....nice base for 2 days coming in and then another day before we left. The Metro to Rome really saves a lot of money......Rome is not difficult to get around in (in spite of a lot of the blog postings) but you DO need to have a map and you DO need to know where things are. It's fun and most Italians are very willing to help.....so many people speak English these days, it's gotten a lot easier to get around as well as a lot of other things. So, if this is what you're looking for, Ostia Antica Park Hotel will be a great hotel for you. One down side.....the beds are standard European......in other words a bit hard.......and the floors are tile so everything seems hard....floor, bed, you get it.....

Reviews.Title: “Close to Fiumicino, not much else”
Reviews.Author: Pittipat2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ostia Antica Park one night, in order to see the ruins at Ostia Antica before flying out from Fiumicino. The hotel's big plus is the airport shuttle at $15Euro per room, which is cheap, very quick and very reliable. Given our taxi adventure getting to Ostia, this was more than enough to make us happy with the place. The hotel itself is fine by tourist class standards: reasonably priced, modern, clean, polite and professional front desk service. The garden and pool area is lovely, though we had a good laugh about access to the pool's being free of charge... as long as you pay a mandatory $6 Euro "towel rental fee." The 3/4 mile walk to the ruins was kind of exciting, given that there are no sidewalks on the busy local highway for the first 3-4 blocks. However, the desk staff did recommend a local bus, for which they sold $1 Euro tickets (the going rate for transit in this area) and which runs quite regularly just steps from the hotel's front door. Overall, we were happy with the choice, particularly as (a) there aren't many options in Ostia and (b) the ruins are a MUST SEE -- fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Krisibunny
Reviews.Content: This was hands down the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at. The bathroom smelled like urine, the bed had springs popping out, the A/C can only turn on certain times of the year, the TV only got five different channels and it was in a very "if-fy" neighborhood. The walls were paper thin so you could hear everything that went on in the rooms next door. There is a pool but they charge you to go in. There is a hot tub but there is a charge to use it. There is internet but, once again, there is a charge. The good thing about it was the closeness to the airport; however, you may find that sleeping in your car is more comfortable and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “It's not for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: Peter_UA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and chose the hotel to meet my particular needs. I wanted somewhere fairly close to Rome Fiumicino airport (but without any aircraft noise), with ample free parking, and comfortable, clean accommodation at a good price. Based on my experience, I’d give it 5 out of 10, but It really should have achieved a better rating, however it was let down by erratic service in several areas. There is a hotel shuttle to and from the airport which runs hourly in the morning, charging 15 Euros per room each way (a taxi is at least 25 Euros), which could make a good deal less good in the end. Also, the hotel is in a residential suburb, and there is really nothing within walking distance, so those without a car would have to catch an infrequent public bus or take an expensive taxi to get anywhere. There is a restaurant on site which offers complimentary breakfast, which I found to be quite variable. Dinner was also available, starting at 20 Euros a head, plus wine, etc. Wi-Fi Internet is available only in the lobby, and costs 5 Euros for 3 hours. The hotel is fairly new and the rooms are reasonably well equipped, with a fridge and decent bathroom (with very small shower), although there was no hot water one morning. Some rooms have a balcony, but there are no in-room tea/coffee making facilities. Housekeeping is somewhat erratic, arriving at 10 am one day and 3 pm the next. Another negative in my view is that the hotel attracts tour bus groups, who were very noisy during my stay and woke me up every night around midnight. In summary, I found this to be quite a nice hotel, which was let down by erratic, variable service and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: lodojofw
Reviews.Content: Just needed a cheap overnight stay near the airport, and other properties closer in were more expensive. We took their shuttle. We had to wait at the airport for an hour and half because it doesn't run midday. It was 20 mins in rush hour and 15 mins non-rush. Ours was a very brief stay because of an early morning flight, but the room was small and clean, bed firm and comfy, bar service nice and overpriced (like every other bar in Italy,) and the restaurant mediocre and overpriced (unlike the other restaurants we had been to.) Found it a good alternative to higher-priced American hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An OK experience..:)”
Reviews.Author: zulmade
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my stay here was overall OK. I needed to stay in a hotel near the FCO airport, therefore, this was the one chosen. I liked the fact that the hotel offered shuttle service for 15 euros each way; other wise I would've had to pay 40 euros one way if I had used a cab. My driver (Adriano) was very friendly, although didn't know a word of English. Was able to communicate a little better using Spanish, which is my main language. When I got there I asked about a restaurant nearby and was told that the only one was the one located within the hotel premises. Check it out and realized that it was too expensive for a night meal, so I just had a box a cookies that I found in the small refrigerator in my room. The front desk attendant was OK; I found him a little arrogant. My room was a right size, but the bed was very unconfortable and had a stentch. The room looked very old with tired looking furniture and the bathrrom, although large, was also very old looking with cheap looking shower. At least the water was warm, so I took a shower and went to sleep. Hardly any, because of the uncomfortable bed. Next morning a got up early and headed towards the airport. My shuttle was ready for me. I was pleasantly surprised when the "new" front desk attendant told me I had time for breakfast and that it was free. There was a selection of cheeses and bread, cereals and fresh fruit. I liked the coffee, even though it came from a machine. The traffic was heavy, but thanks to the skillful shuttle driver (Adriano, again!) I got to the airport on time. I don't think I would stay at this hotel for long periods of time, but for an overnight stay it was OK. The hotel needs to be refurbished, the bed mattresses changed and furniture updated. I would rate the hotel as a two star hotel. Thank you for your attention....:)

Reviews.Title: “Misleading and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: tadham
Reviews.Content: Two points of geography to get clear first: one is that the Ostia Antica Park Hotel is nowhere near Ostia Antica (the hotel suggests you get a bus there) and two, it is nowhere near a park. It is actually situated off a busy road in the middle of suburban nowhere. To get anywhere from this hotel you either have to take public transport of use their over priced shuttle bus. There is a "free" swimming pool, but it is only free if you hire a compulsory pool towel for 6 euros. You can sometimes get service at the bar, as long as you are happy to pay 5 euros for a small beer. The restaurant is run by the same surly, unsmiling people as the bar, but if you order anything less that a full four course meal they will just ignore you for the rest of the evening. We got so fed up trying to ask for the bill that we just got up and walked out, only to have someone come running after us before we were half way across the lobby. (Thought that would work). If you make your way through the back streets heading west you will eventually come to a supermarket where you can get food for a decent price and eat in your room. The room itself was fairly clean except for the footprints on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Sad Ending to a Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: modono
Reviews.Content: We selected the Ostia Antica Park Hotel because of its proximity to Rome Airport. The hotel is situated in the middle of nowhere. We were greeted by a dour desk clerk and when we asked to book the shuttle to the airport for the following morning he said ok it was done, but on later checking we found it was not done and it was fortunate that we rechecked with the next shift because the bus holds 8 and had we not rechecked we could have been stranded as the shuttle was full. We had lunch and used water from the fridge in our room in both cases the staff said we had to pay cash. This makes me suspect that the money went elsewhere. Where we do not know. We took the bus to Ostia, which is a tatty seaside resort and did nothing to raise our spirits! When we booked our evening meal the restaurant manager said we had to eat between 7 and 8:30 PM even though the restaurant was open till 11PM. Dinner was expensive and very poor. We and two other hotel guests seem to have been given another menu as two other parties were served a much more upscale meal and they did not appear to be hotel guests. The room was clean the shower was of a poor quality with doors that did not close easily. All in all we were happy to get out of the hotel in the morning and under no conditions would we have stayed another night. It was a sad ending to a wonderful vacation in Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside of Rome”
Reviews.Author: forte22
Reviews.Content: I do not agree with negative reviews. I like that the bus stopped right in front of hotel. Bus from airport to hotel cheap and fast. I arrived early and staff had my room ready. Town of Ostia very nice. I shopped at grocery store in Ostia ..nice people ..sold wine and good sandwiches. Hotel staff very friendly. Restaurant very good. Nice restaurant next door. The little neighborhood was nice. See the ruins and castle. The bathroom was clean and the room was more than I expected for the price.The beds were no harder than 4star hotels i have stayed in in Rome. On departure I took the 15 euro shuttle and worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to check out the moment we saw our room”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningSoul
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks good on the website but we were quite disappointed. It's in an ugly area (but then most of Ostia Antica looks pretty tatty) and you can only walk to the restaurant next door (which we did--twice!). We booked a standard room for 3 nights. The room was small, cramped with a view over the car park and had a strange smell. There were three beds in it. We asked for another room overlooking the back--but that proved impossible. We took a different room on the front, top (3rd) floor. Though it was equally small and basic, at least it didn't have a 3rd bed taking up limited space. The furnishings look like sub-IKEA. We had a terrace but no chairs to sit on. The shower stall was the cheapest kind of sliding doors that don't work--flimsy and constantly sticking. There is a small pool but you have to pay 6 euros to use it--even though the room costs (for us) was about 135 euros a day--which seemed vastly over-priced. Despite what they advertise, there was no wireless internet connection up in our bedroom on the top floor. You have to pay for internet connection in any case. When I asked for a prosecco on the terrace, the young waiter brought it and then asked for 7 euros in cash. He wouldn't put it on our room tab. I finally realized he was hoping to pocket the cash, when he relented and said "it's a gift" and edged away uncomfortably. It was the usual breakfast buffet but NO fresh fruit at all--just tinned fruit salad. We had to ask for a bowl and ask for cutlery as the overworked staff couldn't keep basic items supplied. The coffee came from an automatic machine and tasted terrible. We left a day early as we so disliked the place.

Reviews.Title: “Way overrated..........”
Reviews.Author: jerbears
Reviews.Content: The price is fine. The staff speaks English well enough. The pool is very nice. That's all that is good about this place. The resturant in the hotel is separately owned and will provide you with a fine 3 course meal with wine. At a high price.....and heaven forbid you want only one course or appetizer. You'll never see a server again the rest of your stay! The bar is run by the resturant and opened for 2 hours in the three days we were there. Of course, the group of business men meeting there received first class service. We had to serve ourselves and return the emptys. The pool is open good hours but costs 12 euros per couple to use...even for a quick dip before dinner. The shuttle to the airport and other places is 15 euros per couple per trip one way. Parking in the covered lot? Even more expensive. Resturant next door was closed with no plans to open ever. They discourage walking to the Super Mercado (which we did anyway) but we found an easy back route through a very nice neighborhood that allowed us to pick up sandwiches and sodas for a song. The frig had to be replaced. The air didn't work. There are 11 channels on the TV if it works. Ours had to be replaced. Obviously, we are not happy with this place and had to get out before it broke us. Do not expect an American type hotel an do expect to wait for everything. Opening times and shuttle times are only an estimation and will be late by as much as !/2 hr. or more.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel for first night in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: PammieJo62
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for our first night in Rome because of its proximity to the airport, their shuttle and because we wanted to tour the ancient ruins. The staff speaks such excellent English, I was truly humbled. The room was nice, but the third bed was, sadly, an air mattress. The restaurant was good and we thought the breakfast was very generous and yummy. We used the shuttle to visit the ruins and our only regret was that we didn't have a cell phone to call them back when we were done -- and that we didn't have more time. Ostia Antica is a more convenient and fascinating alternative to visiting Pompeii. Their shuttle also took us to the train station so we could go to our apt in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “very basic, closed to the airport”
Reviews.Author: travelbob47
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, basic and 15 - 20 min ride from Fiumicino airport (not necessarily in rush hour). Service is spotty. When asked the receptionist to check our flight status we were told that the system was down but we can check ourselves on the internet for 6 euros. The night receptionist was more accomodating. Breakfast consisted of stale croissants, "industrial-type" coffee you have to make yourself on a machine and cheese brought only upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: richlee1malta
Reviews.Content: the staff were so helpful and nearly all could speak good English, the restaurant has an excellent menu, and a good choise of wines, there is also a very good restuaraunt next door. some of our party could not fly back to Ireland due to flight cancelations (Icelands Volcano erupting )they sorted them out with rooms, allowed me to check my flights was ok .and in general could not have been more helpful This hotel is ideal for visiting Rome, there is a bus just out side the hotel that drops you off at the railway station, which runs right into rome. there is a shuttle bus but it is expensive, they are just finishinga lovely swimming pool and patio area, I would most certainly return to this hotel if I ever visit Rome

Reviews.Title: “Serves the purpose”
Reviews.Author: SENIORVAGABONDS
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for one night before returning to the US. The price was right and the location was right. The room was adequate and standard, shower above average. We enjoyed the breadfast, and had dinner in the restaurant at a private restaurant just in back of the hotel which was very good. The shuttle bringing us from the airport to the hotel and returning us to the airport the next day worked well. We used the bus to train station to Rome, a little adventurous but we got to meet the local people. People on bus and bus driver very helpful in getting to destination. Completely missed the ruins in town. Should have done my homework. Any one staying in this town should see the digs. Next time I will.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: WoDatraveller
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel for three nights, mainly to visit Rome... we choosed the hotel cause we travelled by car and did not want to drive inside rome. from the highway its a bit difficult to find. The rooms are clean and big. the tv had only like 6 programms and also those were not really good...;(! You can park ur car for free on the direcht parkinf and go to rome for 1€ with bus and metro. the busses were coming often and the station is right in front of the hotel. its all in all about 45min to go to rome citycenter. I recommend this hotel for everyone who travelles by car or also wants to take a day on the beach (about 20min by bus, though we could not find the hotel beach...) frindly staff, good breakfast Tip: theres a very nice and cheap resturant right next to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: nihon2
Reviews.Content: Was expecting a dive for $65 tax included but was pleasantly surprised. It was only a layover stay, but I would have been happy to have had more time to check out the ruins and lovely neighborhood nearby. They also provided a shuttle to a nearby beach which also looked intriguing. The front desk was extraordinarily helpful in helping me to print out my boarding card. Arriving after 10 p.m., the only problem was that I spent more money on my r/t airport transfer (50 euro total) than I did on the room.

Reviews.Title: “1 lovely week's holiday”
Reviews.Author: MayFairQueenBaby
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's holiday in Ostia Antica Park. Reception & dining room staff very helpful and pleasant. Cleaners, porter and shuttle bus drivers very helpful and pleasant. Reading some of the previous reviews I can't believe we're talking about the same hotel and staff. My two teenage children and I couldn't fault the hotel and its staff. Lovely, clean decor and hot water 24/7. Rooms cleaned every day. Punta Ovest beach, although a short drive away, is easily-reached by hotel minibus, or even the local bus service every 15minutes. The bus stop is RIGHT OUTSIDE the hotel. 1 euro for 75minutes travel be it bus, train or metro. (You couldn't beat it with a big stick!) All in all, we found no faults whatsoever with Ostia Antica Park Hotel. And as for those of you complaining about the '15 Euro transfer per ROOM charge from airport' - HELLO!!! A TAXI WOULD CHARGE YOU 40 EUROS!!! Wave your hands in the air for the Ostia Antica Park Hotel!!! Family from Newtownabbey,Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Kimokanka
Reviews.Content: What stands out for me was how rude the front lobby staff were. Upon arrival, the gentleman working behind the front desk was complaining about other customers that had phoned him and had a negative disposition for the duration of the trip. The restaurant staff was pleasant although simple things like "tap water" were not available and they argued with me when I asked to charge the meal to my room. The taxi that they ordered for me in the morning was like a small mini-van and upon arrival from the airport, the taxi driver asked for 30EU (should be less than 20) because no one else was in the van. The room was musty and dark and the internet was too expensive (most places that I stayed offered internet for free).

Reviews.Title: “Low cost airport stop.”
Reviews.Author: ethicsg
Reviews.Content: Cheap, close, and has a shuttle. Food was good. Nothing to complain about but nothing to cheer.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it is pictured to be!”
Reviews.Author: hollytreestar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing like the pictures on the website. The rooms are tiny and very cheap in construction. The floors have no carpet. There is no furniture except something like an open bookshelf and very cheap portable chairs and a small plastic wood table. The TV is 12" and only a few channels all in Italian. Like others posting here (which I wish I had checked before going) we were aghast when we saw our room and asked for a larger one. The larger one was slightly larger but equally unattractive and poorly equipped. The breakfast was like the cheapest American motel: about 1/4 pound of salami spread out on a plate and basic juice and cereal and hard boiled eggs. Transportation options were limited. We went to the nearby ruins at 8 30 AM by shuttle but could not get back at 4 as the shuttle was not operating. We eventually got a taxi for 15 euros for the five minute ride. The taxi came with about 7 euros already on the meter for the pick up. Worst of all was the staff attitude. As we asked for extra hangers, pillows, and safe instructions, we were met with suppressed guffaws and unpleasant attitudes. This staff are in no way interested in service. It was hard to tell who the other clients were. I saw no other Americans there but large extended Italian families who were rather motley looking and hanging around the lobby. The dinner was expensive and terrible! Only advantage: near the ruins!! Which are great!! We called a driver whom we knew from Rome and made arrangements to check into the airport Hilton the night before our flight instead of remaining here as we had no confidence they would get us to our flight on time and thought they would just chuckle if we missed it.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Convenience”
Reviews.Author: waterangel21
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this hotel just for one night. We had an early flight out, and their website said they were near the airport. This is true. The hotel shuttle (not free) in the morning was easy and took under half an hour. The room was fine and the shower was one of the best we had in Italy. On the downside, the hotel's website made the walk from the train station to the hotel seem easy, only 800m in a straight line. We were lucky that someone from the train took pity on us and offered us a ride, which was at least 4 minutes and took several turns on busy roads with tiny sidewalks. I would not recommend walking it. The hotel offers a shuttle from the train station, but I believe you need to set it up in advance. Also, the restaurant at the hotel, while delicious and decently priced, was severely understaffed. There was one waitress for the whole place, which, except for us, was filled with about 6 groups from 3-10 people each group. Needless to say, the poor waitress couldn't get to everyone, so the service was really slow.

Reviews.Title: “maybe a one star”
Reviews.Author: w0ndering
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the reviews mentioning problems with location; poor signage from train station and we ended up walking to the hotel for lack of info as to how far it was--survived traffic nearby just barely, lugging wheeled case through ditches full of rain for half an hour. Take the bus! Hotel is so far from 'village' and ruins that you need to. Front desk was exactly as helpful as they needed to be and not a bit more friendly than that, though they did change our room when asked and were prompt with the wakeup call. As a little village, most things (very few to begin with in the way of shops or cafes) close in the afternoon; we had planned to visit the ruins but for no apparent reason and with no advance warning they were closed that day (not the fault of the hotel of course but be prepared--it's Italy--but if this happens you may consider whether there is anything else to do there for the day--not in winter. the hotel has 3 or 4 channels of TV, all Italian.) Breakfast basic, pizza at bar ok but does not match description given in elevator menu, be warned. As to the quality of the hotel--clean enough but barely adequate, comparable to cheap plywood constructs I've stayed in in places like remote Turkey or Ukraine (for far less money). Hardest beds ever which is saying something in Italy--lost a lot of needed sleep the night before a long flight. Entire hotel 'decorated' minimally in the 1970s and not touched since, apparently. The advertised internet costs 5 euros per half hour to use--be advised that the little "Bar" in the village, last one on the row going toward the ruins, has FREE internet for customers. The shuttle service was fine but they did tell us we had to leave at 7.00 a.m. to allow an hour to get to the airport, which in fact took 20 minutes so could have left an hour later. We wished fervently that we'd stayed in a B&B in town instead, all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth three stars”
Reviews.Author: patriciabuon
Reviews.Content: We expected a 3 star and paid 130E for our last night in Italy. The web sites we checked assured us the hotel was 3 star, had wireless internet throughout the 'entire' hotel (Booking.com) and was air conditioned. The beds were the most uncomfortable and noisy (creaked loudly with every movement, looked like home built wooden boxes with a thin mattress on top) I have ever experienced in a hotel, the room was tiny and the TV even more minute. There was nowhere to put anything in the equally minute bathroom. The air conditioning had been turned off two weeks earlier, we were told, and internet was only available in an office adjacent to the front desk. When we arrived in Rome by train we called and were assured that if we took the appropriate trains we would be picked up from the Ostia Antica train station - just call and let them know we had arrived. No mention was made that there are no pick ups between 11.00am and 5.00pm. We might have discovered from the web page, but we didn't, and we did have their assurances. We arrived around 3.00pm and called and they told us which bus to catch. That left two no longer young retirees with heavy bags (one recovering from knee surgery) to negotiate a horrendous footbridge with long flights of steps, narrow unmade edges to the road and an anxious period as we tried to find out which direction we should be going in. We lugged our cases onto the bus and when we got off we had to cross one of the most dangerous roads I have encountered. We arrived at check in and there were two men and a woman behind the desk. After seeing the poor standard of our room I went downstairs to express my dissatisfaction. I was informed by the young man at the desk that he was unhappy too, it was a standard twin room and there was nothing to be done! He explained that no one could pick us up because he was alone at the desk - not my observation - that the air conditioning was not broken, it had been turned off, that there was no wireless internet in the hotel. His attitude was 'smart' and unhelpful. We are pretty seasoned travelers. We were fuming about the pick up debacle, but more importantly don't understand how this hotel could ever have been given a three star rating. For a two star, it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend this one.”
Reviews.Author: rinkwell
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at a nearby train station we called the hotel asking them to send a cab. The taxi service ripped us off by refusing to set the meter to zero (we were already under way when we noticed) and charged us an astronomical fee for a 5 minute ride! When we complained to the hotel staff- their response was rude and they refused to accept any responsibility. Overall, the staff was not customer service oriented, verging on being rude. The hotel rooms were clean,however despite the claim for comfortable rooms, none of my family's rooms (we had 5 rooms) were air conditioned. When we called to complain - again, the response was rude and simply - it doesn't work and I don't know when it will. Initially, they lied when they indicated it was only my room, then changed the story to include "the entire hotel." Please avoid this hotel - despite the seemingly reasonable room rate. Not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good standard, value for money hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LinnyLondon
Reviews.Content: I was using this hotel as a base for an early start at the Ostia Antica archeological site. I knew I would be arriving late, so I emailed a few days before arriving to notify them and to check that the reception was open, and also to check the details of how to reach them. The instructions I received back were the same as on their website (take metro, train and then bus from near the Ostia Antica station). Travelling there was fine and simple, until the bus went on a diversion due to road works. So, WARNING; If you are planning on using the bus to get to the hotel, call or email the hotel to check if the road works are still affecting the bus route. They offer a reasonably priced shuttle service and can collect you instead (check hours for this service), so that's not a problem. When I reached the hotel, the reception was helpful and efficient, answering my questions, booked a shuttle for me to get to the archeological site in the morning and getting me quickly to my room. The room was standard, reasonable size, clean and in good condition. Standard sort of buffet breakfast, which was good and plentiful, although it was dispenser type machines for tea / coffee / juice. Quick and easy check out in the morning and the shuttle ride to the Ostia Antica archeological site was really useful, no stress, dropped at the entrance. Overall a good standard, value for money hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: kppr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect place to stay the last night of our trip to Italy. The rooms are basic, but nice and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant surpassed our expectations for dinner and the breakfast was, again, basic but satisfying. The front desk was extremely busy the morning we left - with scheduling shuttles to the airport and many people checking out. I wished for the gentleman's sake that there were two people staffing the desk as there had been the night before when we checked in, but he kept his head and went above and beyond to ensure everyone was taken care of as quickly and efficiently as possible. He spoke excellent English and had a wonderful attitude with a sense of humor. The only problem we had was with the shuttle to the airport, or rather the driver. I understand we are in Italy and did our best with our Italian with no problems the entire trip, but this man spoke no English and, worse, did not understand the names of airlines. His job is to take tourists to the airport! We told him many many times that our airline was Iberia, but he dropped us off at the wrong terminal. He kept asking if we were American. We tried to explain that we needed Iberia Airlines, but he couldn't get past the fact that we were flying to America, so he dropped us off at the American terminal. Because there was no signage, we could not confirm this (we suspected based on the communication) until we waited on a line to get to someone to ask. Fortunately, we had adequate time to hop an airport shuttle and get to the terminal we needed. Were I to stay here again, I would ask the front desk to communicate our destination to the driver. But I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not try to use this hotel if you are not travelling by a car”
Reviews.Author: GalinaCalgary_Canada
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean and comfortable, but don't even think of using it if you are not travelling by a car. The hotel is about 2 km from the Ostia Antica train station, but there is no sidewalk for about 60% of that distance, you have to walk on the road, a very narrow shoulder and lots of cars zipping without even slowing down. There is a bus that stops across the street from the hotel - you can take route 04 from Lido metro station - but this is an experience in itself. The seats on the bus are dirty - not just somewhat dirty, but covered with dirt, and the bus s_m_e_l_l_s! I am not sure what is the deal there, we have ran into no problems with public transportation in Italy, except for this one town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Poor location”
Reviews.Author: txdoc08
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not bad. Breakfast was basic but good. Location is very poor. This is not convenient for visiting Rome. There is a bus outside the hotel that runs infrequently. You then have to transfer to 2 different trains before getting into the city. Public transportation was a problem during our visit - the hotel told us the buses were on strike, so we walked the distance to the train station (about 1 km on a 2 lane road with no sidewalks or shoulder) only to be passed by a bus! Even when waiting for the bus, it can take anywhere from 5 to 30 minutes to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: RagsKP94
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large and clean with free parking on site. Shuttles to the airport and local Ostia Antica excavations are available. We (family of 5) stayed with friends who were flying out the next morning. The restaurant which is attached/affiliated with the hotel was closed (apparently for the season). However the front desk told us of a couple places nearby. We settled on Allo Sbarco di Enea which is right at the entrance to the ruins. Good local food. In the hotel was a snack bar (frozen pizza, panini, drinks, etc.). They also have meeting rooms, though not what we stayed for. Our overall experience was very positive. The price is great during the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive taxi needed for early morning flights”
Reviews.Author: Montanatraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it advertises itself as being near the airport. Bear in mind, however, that if you have an early flight it is not that convenient. The shuttle does not start running until 7 a.m. For my earlier flight, I needed to take a cab, which tried to charge me 35 euros to the airport (meter started at 18). When I protested, the cab driver quickly apologized and reduced the fare to 30, but said his company required the 18 to start. When I called the hotel later to inquire they said this was correct. The shuttle is 10 euros. Rooms are rather small even by italian standards, but clean. The hotel clerk was courteous. My wife and daughter said the breakfast was pretty basic.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: We spent the last night of a 7 night fy/drive package at this hotel since it is near the airport. The traffic and road signage is terrible around the airport and it took us over an hour and much screaming at each other and other motorists to find the hotel. Room 220 was modern and clean with a firm bed. We had a decent meal at the hotel restaurant because to go elsewhere would involve getting in that horrendous traffic again!

Reviews.Title: “Works well if you get it cheap.”
Reviews.Author: Daveesl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in December of 2006. It pretty much met our expectations, nothing great though. The Good... It was dirt cheap. We got it for $60 per night. The rooms were surprisingly large, very clean and ultra modern. It is within about 2 km of Ostia Antica park and about 8 kms from the airport. Made a great jump-off point for our drive south along the coast road. The Bad... Desk staff was rude on all shifts. Room internet access was outrageously expensive ($15 per hour). No food available. Only stay here if you have a car as it would be next to impossible and really dangerous to walk to it. Would I stay here again? Yes, if it was the same price and I had a car and I wanted to be near the airport/the park/outside of Rome. dave

Reviews.Title: “Near FCO airport in wastleand”
Reviews.Author: formershrink
Reviews.Content: The hotel must have included the name "park" in the hotel to show that you can park there. It is certainly not located in a park, since it is in a barren suburban wasteland. Don't go there without a car. We were able, after much getting lost, to drive and park at the nearby Metro stop to easily spend the evening in Rome, but do not leave the hotel without the most precisely mapped out instructions for how to get to the station or you will never, ever find it. For 68 euros, a decent if indifferent value for the price. Easy 10 minutes to the airport and near the Ostia ruins. Can't see any other reason to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Surly staff”
Reviews.Author: CairoDog
Reviews.Content: The hotel tried to rip us off for the shuttle service to the airport. The normal price had to be doubled, they said, because it was a special run to make it to an 8 a.m. flight. They insisted that we had to leave at 5 a.m., for a ten-minute ride, so it would have been easier and cheaper to stay in Rome and take a taxi. To top it off, there were two other groups in the shuttle with us. We were all told this was "special" service and agreed it wasn't an isolated incident. When we questioned the front desk on this, they were rude and used profanity.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Parkhotel”
Reviews.Author: Evka
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the hotel by car, which was ok, but definitely not an easy place to find, make sure you have a good map and lot of patience. The hotel itself was ok, the rooms were nice and clean, our room had large balcony with fairly nice view, breakfast was included in price and they had pretty good selection. Parking was free and fairly safe, but do not leave any valuables in your car, this applies not only to Rome, but to all of Italy (and all of Europe for that matter - including our own home country). DO NOT TRY TO WALK TO THE TRAIN STATION or vice versa. Just wait for the bus (number 04) just outside the hotel, it will come sooner or later, sometimes we have waited for five minutes, other times for thirty minutes, but the bus eventually came. The hotel reception does not have tickets (B.I.T. ticket cost 1EUR is valid for all Rome transport means and 75 minutes), but you can buy them at the train station. The first time on the bus we have travelled without a ticket...there were no inspectors, but you never know...There is nowhere to go for dinner around the hotel, since there is absolutely nothing except for family homes. To get to the nearest village/train stop is pretty decent hike and it is definitely not a pleasant walk along the extremely busy road with no pathways or you can get lost in the maze of side streets where none of them leads directly to the station . There is a supermarket near, but again, it is not a short distance and it is also difficult to find. We would stay in the hotel again as it is fairly good value for money and the hotel itself is nice, but just make sure you take the above into account and you will not be unpleasantly surprised expecting something else.

Reviews.Title: “Big business box hotel”
Reviews.Author: splicha
Reviews.Content: There is good and bad about this hotel. It is very close to the airport and Ostia Antica. If those are your main requirements then it is a big, plain, clean, business class hotel with good included breakfast. We had a very, very early flight out of Rome and the hotel worked great for that. If you do not NEED to stay by the airport or Ostia Antica then don't stay here. For the same money you can stay at a really nice place right in Rome (and still do Ostia as a day trip on the subway). I found this hotel to be too expensive for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly incompetent receptionists”
Reviews.Author: Nabu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of artists who were performing at the open air Roman theatre in Ostia Antica. The previous night we'd been put up at the Aris Garden Hotel in Ostia, which was miles better and cost the same and has a great swimming pool. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere. It's also too far to walk in the heat to the Ostia Antica ruins, which are on the same road but about a couple of km away along a main road with no pavement/sidewalk. The only good thing and the reason people stay there is the cheap shuttle bus to and from the airport. The first thing that happened was that my group had to check in without me because I was called to the theatre for an urgent problem. Since the group is well travelled and the person I left in charge of check in spoke Italian, I didn't think there would be any problems, also because the hotel had received a fax with our rooming list and knew that we were arriving. I was so wrong! Next thing I know I get a call from the personal cellphone of one of the artists telling me that the hotel would not let them check in because I wasn't there to "guarantee" for them. The receptionist had also been very rude to the person I left in charge, who by the way is the director of the artists as well as main dancer. What made it worse in my eyes was that, although the receptionist had my cell number and the group obviously could have given it to him if he couldn't be bothered to find it on the fax, he didn't even offer to call me, leaving my group to have to do it themselves. When I managed to get to the hotel a couple of hours later everything had been sorted out and people were in their rooms. I saw the WiFi sign on the hotel door and in the reception and asked whether they charged for access and the same receptionist said they did. I remarked that prices are usually skyhigh and would just connect my portable through my cell phone and he told me their prices were even higher than the ones I mentioned. In any case, the service turned out not to be working, not even on the lobby computer. That same afternoon, I called reception (there was a girl this time) to ask for a couple of room number belonging to my group and was promptly asked crossly whether I didn't have a rooming list with me. I replied that the guy in the morning hadn't provided me with one and I hadn't asked, after the various misunderstandings, and she herself admitted that when the guys are there in the morning they always make a mess of things. So much for company image! The rooms were okay but not worth the price we paid. A few people in my group said theirs were really dirty, both walls and furnishings. My bathroom had no light except for the one on the mirror. Fortunately we were at the theatre all day and only needed them for sleeping. Breakfast was ok as far as pastries and cakes were concerned but the coffee from the automatic vending-type machine was horrible. Luckily a waitress offered to make me some at the bar. At 10.00 o'clock, as soon as I'd had breakfast, I wrote out on a sheet of paper how I needed my invoices made out and left them with the same male receptionist that had been rude the previous morning, asking him to please have them ready by 12 when we were leaving. I was back at the desk at 12 and, obviously, he hadn't even started on them! There were a lot of people checking in and out and he was alone except for another girl who was just standing around and not being much help. He thus wrote out the first invoice and got my company's name wrong. I pointed this out and he got angry at me and showed me a sign that said that requests for invoices must be made the night before. I told him he had our reservation fax that clearly stated we would need an invoice and that in any case I'd handed him all the details again 2 hours previously. In a huff, he started on the invoice again, while the girl made a sarcastic comment in English to him (did she think I wouldn't understand?!?!?!). My group and I finally left and when we got to the next hotel one of our group realised she'd left her passportl!!! And I had checked the night before whether anyone had left their passport and was told that apparently they'd all been picked up. I really dreaded calling the hotel back. The afternoon receptionist was there and she wasn't at all helpful either, just said that they could not arrange for it to be sent but that we would have to send a courier to pick it up. Luckily our main office is in Rome and they were able to send a courier, end of the story. I am telling all the people I know in the theatre business never to use that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: bellagirl11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was close to the airport, and it was fine, although I checked in at 1.30am and left at 10.00am, so didn't see too much of it. (The taxi driver had no problem finding it). There is a 24 hr reception, which is very helpful. The rooms were a decent size, although the bedspread didn't look like it had been cleaned recently. It wasn't the quietest hotel that I have stayed at, being very close to a main road, but it wasn't a big problem. A good breakfast was provided. The big bonus was the airport shuttle - 10 euro per room, compared to a taxi fare of at least 25 euros (at 1.00am). Leave at least 40 mins to get to the airport though, although it was only about 10-12km, the traffic was horrendous, so it was a slow trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to view ruins or stay outside Rome”
Reviews.Author: lud2006
Reviews.Content: The description we found on the internet was true except for distance to airport which is more like 10 or 12 km. Owner was very accomodating as was her son Mauro with whom we corresponded via email. Accomodations were basic and reflected the price. Train that connects to Metro is only 100 meters away. Snack bar at the station had coppuchinio at 85 euro cents per cup. A tourist bargain. This visit was a location play and turned out perfect. Spend three days here with two local visiting days and one day back to the Borghese Museum costing only one euro each way on the combo train/metro tickect. Staying here at end of two week visit was good choice. Outside eating area could be chilly in cool weather. Probably won't do it again here but will try the same technique of staying close to airport at end of trip. No rushing on last day.

Reviews.Title: “omg”
Reviews.Author: buggles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from everything the only way to get anywhere is to go on the bus then the train. There are no pavements round the area and it is very easy to get bumped by cars if you walk along the road. The staff are very unhelpful except the barmaid. Two americans asked to use the internet while we were there and were told the reception staff were too busy. The internet is very expensive 15 euros for 2 hours. There was no air conditioning while we were there it was switched off by the manager because it was not hot enough 70 odd degrees at the time, we had to leave the balcony window open. The safes were not working either and they were not interested. Directions were awful but we eventually found our way. If you are on the outskirts like this is it is helpful to buy a 4 euro all day ticket which goes on buses trains and the metro for one whole day, but a lot of the time the hotel cannot supply these. There is a supermarket about a 5/10 minute walk down the road. The taxi driver took us the long way from the airport and tried to charge us 78 euros, the hotel have a mini van which cost 10 euros from and too the airport though it is not advertised well. There is very little to do round the area and again you have to travel by bus to get to the beach a fair distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: dbtrue
Reviews.Content: The Ostia Antica Park Hotel is in a great location for departure from Fiumicino Airport if you have a rental car. There is ample parking in an enclosed and gated courtyard with TV surveillance. We had an early flight so had to leave the hotel about 5 a.m., but there was an agent at the desk to operate the electric gate and let us out. Rooms are nice, and the hotel is very high tech, with electronic door locks, digital heat/ac controls, etc. In the past, we have had good breakfast there, too, but this time we left too early for the breakfast. People at desk were friendly and helpful. (Too bad others have had taxi problems.) Also would like to mention that hotel is a great place to stay if you wish to visit the Ostia Antica ruins, which are worth 2-3 hours of an afternoon. Best to have a rental car, though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: cosmos328is
Reviews.Content: I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. It's unfortunate that the previous reviewer described such a terrible experience - ours couldn't have been more opposite! The staff were fantastic, so lovely, helpful and chatty - we were so sad to say goodbye to them! When we struggled with finding the hotel from the town centre on our arrival a phone call to the hotel had staff guiding us in the whole way. They were truly great and then took great care of us throughout our stay showing us how to get in to Rome and move around the resort. They warned us not to take taxis in the area as they are too expensive, far from ordering them for us, even providing us with a shuttle in the morning to the local station to take the train in to Rome. The hotel was situated about 25 minutes from Rome centre by public transport. A bus stops right outside the hotel and takes you to the local train station - Ostia Antica. This train takes you to the Metro station - Pyramid - in the center of Rome. The last train from Pyramid to Ostia Antica is at 10pm and the buses appear to run very late. Each night, after our day of sightseeing in Rome, it was a pleasure to get back on the train and get out of the city back to our hotel. The hotel does not offer dinner, but as we had a car with us we went to nearby Lido de Ostia - right on the beach - for supper on a couple of evenings and there is a lovely castle close to the hotel which has a very romantic restaurant in it's grounds. The staff were also happy to call out for pizza for us if we wanted to take it easy in our room after a day on our feet taking in the sights of Rome. The rooms were of an average size, very clean and modern with mini bar and TV which provided CNN for a news catch up at home. The bathrooms were lovely - very new with a great power shower and a good sized bath. The breakfast in the morning was traditional continental, although 1 day we treated ourselves to a traditional English breakfast at Babington’s at the foot of the Spanish steps. I would have no problems in highly recommending this hotel if you want to see Rome but can't afford the really expensive hotels in the centre and don't want to risk paying less for a city based hotel and ending up in a horrible place. The price of this hotel is excellent and the accommodation and staff top class. If you don't have a car with you, I'd be hesitant in recommending it - simply because once you've finished your day in Rome and traveled back to the hotel, you might want to take a rest and hit the town again in the evening. This isn't possible at this hotel, unless you have a car with you or don't mind taking the bus ride to town.

HotelInfo.Name: Ostia Antica Park
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Dei Romagnoli 1041 A, 00119 Rome, Italy
